get.description: Returns Immunizations based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size & _pretty are query parameters used for Paging).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Immunization. Sample ids are: 5022, 14551, 3341, 14565, 3342.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: The _summary parameter requests the server to return only the elements marked as summary in their definition.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Vaccination (non)-Administration Date. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Vaccination (non)-Administration Date. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: dose-sequence
parameters.description: What dose number within series?

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Business identifier. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The service delivery location or facility in which the vaccine was / was to be administered (Location).

parameters.name: lot-number
parameters.description: Vaccine Lot Number.

parameters.name: manufacturer
parameters.description: Vaccine Manufacturer (Organization).

parameters.name: notgiven
parameters.description: Administrations which were not given. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient for the vaccination record (Patient).

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: The practitioner who administered the vaccination (Practitioner).

parameters.name: reaction
parameters.description: Additional information on reaction (Observation).

parameters.name: reaction-date
parameters.description: When did reaction start? The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: reaction-date
parameters.description: When did reaction start? The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Why immunization occurred. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: reason-not-given
parameters.description: Explanation of reason vaccination was not administered. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: The practitioner who ordered the vaccination (Practitioner).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Immunization event status. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: vaccine-code
parameters.description: Vaccine Product Administered. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: stateid
parameters.description: Unique id associated with a page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Immunization resource offset.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of Immunization resources requested in a page.

parameters.name: _pretty
parameters.description: Set true to get prettified data.

parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: The _summary parameter requests the server to return only the elements marked as summary in their definition.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Vaccination (non)-Administration Date. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Vaccination (non)-Administration Date. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: dose-sequence
parameters.description: What dose number within series?

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Business identifier. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The service delivery location or facility in which the vaccine was / was to be administered (Location).

parameters.name: lot-number
parameters.description: Vaccine Lot Number.

parameters.name: manufacturer
parameters.description: Vaccine Manufacturer (Organization).

parameters.name: notgiven
parameters.description: Administrations which were not given. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient for the vaccination record (Patient).

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: The practitioner who administered the vaccination (Practitioner).

parameters.name: reaction
parameters.description: Additional information on reaction (Observation).

parameters.name: reaction-date
parameters.description: When did reaction start? The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: reaction-date
parameters.description: When did reaction start? The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Why immunization occurred. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: reason-not-given
parameters.description: Explanation of reason vaccination was not administered. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: The practitioner who ordered the vaccination (Practitioner).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Immunization event status. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: vaccine-code
parameters.description: Vaccine Product Administered. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

200.description: The set of resources associated with a particular Immunization.
